(ref: nanking-complaints.html)Hi Bill, I would like to talk to you concerning your "history of japan" video. Why have you glossed over the atrocities Japan has committed, which are major events in Japan's history? Examples include the Rape of Nanking, the South Korean Comfort Women, and the human testing conducted on Chinese civilians. These are important issues that cannot be forgotten. However, they are not present at all in your video, which has been viewed over 16 million times. This is encouraging the ignorance of the "darker side" of Japan's history. While countries such as Germany have deeply apologized for their war atrocities and engrain these events in teaching history to their students, the Japanese government has refused to apologize and Japanese textbooks are being revised to omit these events. I sincerely believe that you are a very learned and good person, thus I hope that you are aware of this and that with your large following and outreach, I hop e that y ou may also raise awareness of this issue. Japan's war atrocities are not to be glossed over. Happy Chinese New Year.

i spent most of 2011 trying to learn to use more 'normal' forms. but the overwhelming opinion from the fans was 'no, don't be normal.' they all liked the 'weirder' stuff better. then during 2012-13 i went on a huge writing binge and i began finishing every unfinished thing i had ever written, and also starting many new songs as well, and really was able to combine the best of both ends of the spectrum, and just wrote a huge amount of stuff, and really rounded out my skills. at the end of 2013 i felt totally bulletproof, songwriting wise. and just when i was ready to start recording songs ferociously for the rest of my life, i thought it would be a good idea to start making videos instead

What is something you wonder?

i wonder how people find a reasonable workflow when exporting files out of blender. from what i understand, when you export a file, it drops into a certain folder with no prompt for name or location, and automatically overwrites the previous export. so if you are exporting a lot of files, you have to manually open up a window, and change the name to something else, and also there is NO prompt to warn you if you are about to overwrite. so even if you have the guts to go in and open up the window to choose a new freakin name every time, YOU are responsible for keeping track of what names you have used, or else you risk overwriting a file. the way i see it, there are 2 reasonable ways this could work: number append, or prompt and warn. prompt and warn would be like you have to name the file before save it and if you choose a name that has already been chosen it says WAIT hold on you already named something that. number append would be fine also, that's what cameras do -- it means it never asks you to name your pictures, it just automatically names them with a number after it, 1 number higher each time, so you are never bothered to name your pictures, and never risk overwriting. Now imagine this horrific situation: imagine if your camera names your first picture "picture." and then you take a second picture and it names that picture "picture" also, and deletes the first picture. UNLESS you open up a window before you take each picture and come up with a name before you take each picture, and oh by the way it is not going to warn you if you are choosing a name you have chosen before. so you are responsible for keeping track of what names you have used, or else you risk wiping out previous pictures. From what i can tell, this is the behavior blender uses when exporting files. now i'm sure blender is fine, and many people use it, and i'm sure there is a reasonable way to work on projects and export files on a regular basis and not risk having them be constantly wiped out if you don't manually name them something different each time AND keep a manual running record of all the names you used ..... but i don't know how it would be done. i abandoned that program long ago because of this issue, but it still remains a deep existential conundrum as to how blender users actually would deal with this. that is what i wonder

Why does jerry give George a nickel and two other coins to buy a 50 cent candy bar in a certain episode of Seinfeld, when a nickel doesn't add up with any two other coins to fifty cents?

Hey Bill, do you have any advice on how I can recognize chords in the songs in The Real Book sixth edition? I never understand what half diminished or what the seventh of a chord is, and I always forget if the seventh is by default minor/a half step down unless stated otherwise.

really simply, here are the rules: 
Cmaj7 is maj 3, maj 7. so C, E, G, B
Cmin7 is min 3, min7. so C, Eb, G, Bb
C7 (technically "C dominant 7") means maj 3 and min 7. so C, E, G, Bb
Cdim (diminished symbol is a small circle) is probably just 3 notes, min3 and b5. so C, Eb, Gb.
Cdim7 is crazy, it's min3, b5, and double flat 7 which would actually just be a six. so in other words, this chord is stacked minor thirds forever. it is sort of a dizzy feeling and was mainly used in like the 1930s i guess? really old stuff etc.
C half-dim (a circle with a line through it) is Cdim but a regular FLAT7 not a double flat 7. so C, Eb, Gb, Bb. Another name for this is Cmin7b5 which is a more complicated sounding name, but more clearly states what is actually in the chord. i think realbook usually calls it Cmin7b5. this is the one you will usually see as part of a 2-5 in a minor key. so in the key of Cmin you would commonly see Dmin7b5, G7(b9), Cmin. or something like that.
ok that's the general rules, now, rule #2 is, never play the root note in the chord, swap it out and let the bass play it. and also make sure you always change the octave of all the notes so it's comfortable. so for example, play C maj7 like this:  C in the bass, then G below middle C, then B below middle C, then E above middle C.  and Fmaj7 would be F in the bass, then A below middle C, middle C, then E above middle C. get used to flipping all the chords around so they are comfortable in the middle range, and leave out the bass.
step 3 is to vamp through the chord changes in like a simple sort of bossa nova groove, (because it's simple and probably works for anything) no melody, just vamp the chord changes in this way. take your time, and follow the rules.
now play every song in the book that way and GET READY TO REALIZE STUFF

if i eat memory foam will i gain more memories?

no. the foam gets the memories, and it is very short term, and it is only physical. and it would only work if you suddenly became twice as big, the foam would stay small, for a few seconds. it is important to remember that more solid non-foam objects have almost infinite physical memory. memory foam is called memory foam to differentiate it from regular foam, which has no physical memory. this also only applies to physical states which are smaller than its resting state. i hope that makes sense

Sorry this is so long, I've just had a bunch of questions I've wanted to ask and I figured I might as well ask them all at once.From what I gather, the reason you don't collaborate is because you have a specific artistic vision (and a very specific style) for everything you do, and it would be very difficult to get someone else to use the same style or approach your work with the same vision.
you might be right
Is there more to it than that?

it's worse. everyone always feeds you this idea of how sacred and holy collaboration is, (and i agree with it), always pointing to the great collaborations (lennon/mccartney, etc etc etc). so i always believed that that was important. but there's one problem, what if i don't have any friends? what if i just can't seem to meet anyone who wants to spend their life doing the kinds of things that i'm doing? what if everyone around always wants to just, i dunno, go home and watch the oscars or something. what if i really can't find anyone? so i felt sad and guilty for a long time, thinking that you are supposed to collaborate but i just can't find people cuz i'm cursed or something. and then one day, i saw an interview clip from a very famous and well respected songwriter (i wish i could find the clip, i would post a link to it) that said "you know, i don't collaborate well. that's one of the reasons i like songwriting, is because it's something you can do all by yourself." and that is when it became clear. i had already given up on finding collaborators, but seeing that clip was what made me stop feeling bad about it

sorry this is a long/multipart question. i think it's a little silly and maybe a deliberate misdirect to say you don't care about 'politics' or aren't 'political' in some sense,
i think politics is a weird word and i am not sure what it is really supposed to mean

and i think it's pretty clear in many of your videos. i mean, a lot of your videos are about critiquing corporate culture and consumerism by appropriating corporate language and musical techniques and juxtaposing them with surreal or humorous circumstances in order to reveal corporate society's perverse absurdity.
i didn't realize that was called politics, i sort of thought politics is like when you care about which of the 2 eligible contestants will win a campaign for presidency, or something like that

take, for instance, your "sponsor movie" video, which involves you scream-singing "coke" for around thirty seconds, which quite pointedly reveals the insane and almost violent aspects of advertising, or "how about going to the mall?" where you sing a fake and repetitive advertisement from "ShitMall", which i feel leaves little to no ambiguity for how you feel about malls and advertising. of course, you've also communicated your anti-advertising and anti-cor porate stances in the past on this very questions page, citing them as a reason why you won't turn on advertising on your youtube videos.

it's really like if you are on a long car ride and your brother keeps kicking your seat, and he will never, never, never, never stop and also doesn't seem to hear you asking him to stop. it's not so much a political view but more just losing your mind eventually, and drawing interpretive paintings about the eternal kicking

there are numerous other examples in your videos: "colonization" has you singing the word "colonization" over the image of a U.S. city skyline, implying that, indeed, the U.S. city is a product of colonization and colonial life; "jazz america" has you improvising over a scrolling neon text of the U.S. declaration of independence, a choice which could have a number of interpretations but isn't exactly politically 'neutral'; the christmas video is another send up of corporatism which encourages viewers to "stay home from work to be with your family" while reassuring them not to worry because "the people that work in the 24 hour stores will still go to work", including the corporate logos of mcdonald's, walgreen's, and *foxconn factories*, highlighting a hypocritical imbalance central to capitalism and consumerism; the japan video take great pains to  'correct' us and inform us that only "rich important people hired samurai. poor people who could not afford to hire samurai did not hire samurai".
wow, what an incredibly thorough, world class, razor sharp, psychiatric-grade analysis. i hope you have an opportunity to do this professionally in some capacity if you don't already

i am listing/analyzing so many examples in order to illustrate that your interest in the struggles of those exploited by class systems and the absurdity/horror of consumerism/corporatism are continuing, multi-year topics of interest that appear in many of your videos, topics which are hardly that of someone who "do[es] not have any opinion on politics".
i did not know that is called politics. i thought politics was when someone promises that they have the ability to somehow 'fix' those issues
it's part of why i personally enjoy a lot of your work so much. i can understand wanting to let your work speak for itself,
i think that is generally a good strategy
or being coy about your views in order to protect your privacy or to protect against internet backlash...
oh hell yeah 23,000 questions will do that to you

but unless you're being ironic or satirical in your answers below (which is perfectly understandable, many of your videos have ironic and satiric elements) or are using a particularly narrow definition of politics, then i can't quite make heads or tails o f what y our videos and songs say you believe versus what you say you believe.so for the actual questions part: what do you mean when you say you "do not have any opinion on politics"?what is your definition of what is "political" or not?

i don't have a firm definition of politics, (which is probably why i stay away from it) but from what i can tell it usually means people with great public speaking skills trying to convince audiences to elect them. seems legit, but it is not something i am terribly interested in. if politics happens to be the name of something i am interested in, then i would prefer to call it something different, because it seems like the word politics has come to be associated with failure, confusion, and frustration.
